articles.title: Why This Investor Is a Stock Market Optimist
articles.content: "The stock market always goes down faster than it goes up, but it always goes up more than it goes down."

articles.title: Dow, S&P 500 finish higher for third trading day on investor optimism about Russia-Ukraine
articles.content: All three major stock indexes end higher despite earlier losses on Monday as investors turn optimistic about the Russia-Ukraine talks.

articles.title: Apple’s “Coda” Oscar is a win for the hybrid release model
articles.content: Apple's "Coda" Oscar win is also a win for hybrid movie releases that debut in theaters and on streaming simultaneously

articles.title: The Best Metaverse Stocks to Consider Buying Now

articles.title: 5 things to know about 'CODA' --- the Apple TV+ film making Oscar history
articles.content: 'CODA' is the first movie released by a streaming service to win best picture, and star Troy Kotsur is the first deaf man to take home an acting Oscar.

articles.title: Apple Didn't Beat Netflix at the Oscars This Time
articles.content: Apple TV+ won the Best Picture award with "Coda" on Sunday, but Netflix is just getting started.

articles.title: Alphabet (GOOGL) Updates Gmail With Pause Notification Feature
articles.content: Alphabet's (GOOGL) Google introduces a new feature in Gmail to pause mobile notifications while using the desktop client, per a report.

articles.title: Apple's (AAPL) CODA Makes History, Wins Oscar for Best Film
articles.content: Apple (AAPL) wins its first-ever Oscar with CODA, which is a movie with a predominantly deaf cast.

articles.title: UBER Wins 30-Month License to Continue Operations in London
articles.content: UBER's 30-month London license win comes at a time when the company is nearing pre-pandemic levels of growth in its ride-hailing operations.

articles.title: Tesla Mulls Stock Split: Why This Analyst Says It's A Smart Strategic Move
articles.content:
Tesla, Inc. (NASDAQ: TSLA) announced in an 8-K filing Monday it will seek shareholder approval for increasing its authorized share capital to allow a stock split in the form of a stock dividend.
Tesla's board has vetted the proposal and shareholders will vote on it at the company's 2022 annual meeting.
An analyst at Wedbush sees the potential stock split as a catalyst for the EV stock. 
The Tesla Analyst:  Daniel Ives maintained an Outperform rating and $1,400 price target for Tesla shares.
The Tesla Takeaways:  A second split of Tesla stock in as many years is a "smart strategic move" that will serve as a catalyst for shares going forward, Ives said in a note.
Tesla's previous 5-1 stock split announced in August 2020 ...Full story available on Benzinga.com
